reviews.review_msg: Did not actually teach us during lecture. All we did was homework that we would come into class to discuss in groups and call her when needed. Entire text book is in Spanish which was frustrating. Deffs not a beginners class but you won't fail if you barely know any Spanish. Quite vague about assignments. Assumed we all knew how to use certain term

This course is taken in order to learn or further expand your knowledge of Spanish, Rita does neither. Does not teach & expects you to self teach, gives an unreasonable amount of homework to introductory students, inconsistent with marks, offers to boost marks if you don't understand instead of teaching, instructions are not reliable, overall awful

She NEVER teaches in class. There are so much homework and preparation. I try my best to finish ALL of them but it takes me more than 4 hours per week because I have no knowledge in Spanish. I honestly do not like her 'teaching' style because all she does is put us in groups and learn by ourselves. This is too stressful.

Very disorganized. Did not teach at all. She makes you do the online exercises which is very time consuming, so there's no point going to class. Puts you in groups and expects you to learn from each other. Focuses on non-important material. Does not know her own syllabus outline. Avoid this class with her. Take it with another prof!

not a good teacher at all.  makes u feel dumb if you don't know an answer.  i felt so bad for some of the students in class 'cause she treated them like they were idiots if they got a wrong answer.  she's not very clear, etither - speaks waaaaay too fast.  two thumbs waaaay down.

Nice woman, but LOUSY teacher!!!  Belittles students when they don't know the answer, and doesn't help them correct their mistakes - just rolls her eyes and tells them to study harder.  VERY hard class - you must memorize entire textbook!
No Comments
hmmm dont get why some said "she is mean". She is pretty nice and funny lady and always want to make sure you understand. It is not a super easy course tho

Ester is a very nice person and a good teacher, however this class is extremely difficult if you have no background in spanish. Quizes are online, which is bogus as heck, and the oral exam is only worth 10%. No curving, no partial marks and computer graded quizes is a joke for a language class. If you want people to have interest, make it human

Basically you have to learn by yourself! going to class is just to let her test you. Well, for me she is mean because as a person who know nothing about spanish, i have tried my best but how could she ask me : why others are smarter than you? WTF

Had her for both 102 and 103. One of the best profs I've encountered in university. Always willing to help as long as you try in class. Yes, the work load is heavier than expected but you learn so much. Definitely recommended.

first of all, the class is not easy. you have to prepare before everyclass. i took this class as a gpa booster, but i got the lowest mark out of all mine. but ester is a really nice person. she cares about you and wants u to do well in the course. she brought us brownies crackers cheese cookies for the last class. best prof ever!

Ester is a great prof and extremely nice, just don't fight with her and don't try to get sympathy. She is tough and stubborn so if you want her appreciation, STUDY! This was the most fun I've had in a class ever. The entire class (22 students) was SO tight by the end and we all took Ester out to dinner. The class ain't easy though, so read the book
very helpful if interested in the language, but also understands those who take it for because they have to

she expects A LOT! we have 25 students in our class and 20 of us prepare in advance for the class. she explains things clear but she is VERY PICKY. spelling marks dedcuted even if your answer is 100% correct. she talks very fast as if we should understand 100% of what she says when we've only taken a beginners class for 3 months!!
Genuinely nice person. She is a bit demanding and the course goes fairly fast, but if you keep on top of your work and do as she says (prepare in advance), you'll have no problem.
She is amazing!! i didn't do well in the course but Ester was so helpful! you can tell she really loves her job and wants you to do well! i highly recommend taking the class with her!!
No Comments
A wonderful prof! Amazingly, she made learning a new language fun! Very patient and very helpful, I highly recommend this prof for those taking a language for the first time!

Nice prof, but expects too much her students. The course outline says that "You should expect to spend roughly 6?8 hours per week in class preparation and language lab activities." The reality is you need to spend double of that just to get a passing grade from her. She explains most of the things in Spanish in an introductory class. Go figure.

I like her class and her teaching style. But, I don't like the way she grades her students. She is way too harsh on participation marks. Even you speak Spanish in her class, she might end up hating you just because you are not very enthusiastic enough. Remember, DO NOT TAKE 102 with her because she never uses English to teach Spanish.
Really great prof. Always envolve class in different conversations and activities. Must take span with her:)
She is harder than the other Span. Profs.
Excellent class!!! Loved it!
Excellent class and prof. Very fun.  Keep on top of things and you'll do fine.I recommend it completely.
No Comments

Her class was awesome. The first few weeks are rather intimidating because she starts off in Spanish right away, but don't be discouraged. You learn fast. Shes a wonderful lady and has a lot of experience behind her. Her teaching ability is very natural and you learn alot from her... plus shes absolutely hilarious.
Thank God i only had her for a day (my instructor was away), she was pretty scary
very stimulating, overall i liked the course
she is such a nice lady.  she makes the class fun and forces you to learn.  she has no problem giving you extra help when you need it.
She's very funny when she's in a good mood!
great class
helpful and interested in the students, fun class
Really cares about her students. Expects a lot, but will help you achieve it!
i really enjoyed the class
best class ever, never want to leave SFU because of her
No Comments
No Comments

I took Spanish for 4 years before taking this course so it was really easy for me. She explains concepts and takes feedback well. A very easy marker on tests, but gives out seemingly random participation marks. Will not move on if she calls you and you don't know the answer (it's painful). She is very nice & understanding & a native Spanish speaker
Isabel is such a good professor. She explains things clearly, marks fairly, and most of all she treats her students with respect and wants them to succeed. Would definitely take again!

It was a good class because I dont have time to go to campus... I had to study every week, though. I liked the material and textbook. Isabel was very helpful,.. you have to prepare your questions before having a session with her.

She is great, but this class is a lot of work. I found it hard to keep up. She offered lots of help and did one-on-one sessions with me, which made a huge difference. I would take another class with her, but I would not do Spanish online -- you just don't get to experience the language the same way.

SPN 110 online was easy, not too much work. Just keep up with exercises (there's a bit, but they're all easy) and you'll fly through this course no sweat. She's super helpful and grades easy. No assignments, only chapter quizzes (9 of them) and oral exam and final, which was all fair

This online class was a lot of work. Do not take it if you are looking for something easy. You have to put in a lot of effort and complete all the activities. She is really helpful if you need to clarify or ask questions. She expects you to work hard.

I took this course bcuz her rating was really good. But I regret so much. The course load is very busy. You have a lot of assignment and not easy quiz almost once in a week. And also there is a oral test and you should get more than 50% in the final otherwise you will fail this course. She expects too much from you. Don't take this course.

Okay I read all the comments below and took this class.sit there and submit online assignments. But Quizes are hard and so is everything else.BUT its sooo much work. you are expected to make sentences. And spanish language is vast and hard. Trust me you dont want to take this course if you dont know previous spanish. I am regretting it now
Very easy Distance Ed. course although bit time consuming due to too many small assignments. She is very helpful and encouraging. Quizzes are fairly easy.

Pretty easy to get a good mark on the Distance Ed if you put in the work. Never spoke a word of Spanish in my life before taking it and did really well. Completing the assignments on time is MANDATORY, online assignments are worth 60% of your mark. First 2 quizzes easy, but final was harder as there was a ton of verbs, vocab + grammar to remember.

She is a very encouraging prof.. an essential characteristic as a language teacher. Won't upset you even if you are dumb! She wants the students to do well.. and it shows. No exam, but four big tests that are on the computer which are tough. With a little bit of studying you can get really good marks. Textbooks explains everything really well.

I took 102/103 with Isabel, both classes were great! She's very helpful, nice and willing to bend over to help any student. Her classes are engaging, and are easy A's if you attend and participate. One of the best profs I've had at SFU! If you're interested in Spanish, or just want to learn a language for fun, or even just for credit take her class

She's really great! If you are wanting to take a spanish course, take it wish Isabel. She is very helpful and fair and she actually cares if people understand the stuff or not. Her tests are taken on the computer and are pretty easy if you read the textbook and practice.
awesome prof. super nice. she looks scary but is actually not mean at all. Tests are not that hard if you keep up in class and read the textbook.
